Teaching & Workshops

University Teaching

Advanced Machine Learning and Computer Vision
Lecturer / Associate Professor | University-level Courses | Oct 2020 - Present | Cotonou, Benin

Teaching advanced topics in machine learning and computer vision at the university level. Courses cover deep learning architectures, convolutional neural networks, computer vision fundamentals, and practical applications of ML algorithms.

Workshops Led

Implementation of Diffusion Models
Workshop Lead | Benin Workshop on Artificial Intelligence (BWAI) | Nov 17-22, 2025 | Benin

Leading a hands-on workshop on implementing diffusion models, covering theoretical foundations and practical applications of state-of-the-art generative models.

Community Engagement & Events Attended

Deep Learning Indaba X Benin - 4th Edition
Co-Organizer | Dec 3-5, 2025 | Cotonou, Benin

Co-organizing the 4th edition of Deep Learning Indaba X Benin, bringing together researchers, students, and practitioners to share knowledge and advance machine learning research in West Africa.

African Computer Vision Summer School (ACVSS)
Participant | July 13-23, 2025 | Kigali, Rwanda

Intensive training in advanced computer vision techniques, including 3D reconstruction, object detection, semantic segmentation, and neural rendering methods.

Deep Learning Indaba Conference
Participant | August 17-22, 2025 | Kigali, Rwanda

Attended Africa's premier machine learning conference, engaging with cutting-edge research and networking with researchers across the continent.

xAI: AI Applications in Sciences
Workshop Participant | Imperial College London | Apr 22 - May 10, 2025 | Muizenberg, South Africa

Participated in an intensive workshop exploring explainable AI and its applications across scientific domains, hosted by Imperial College London researchers at AIMS.

The Science and Engineering of LLMs
Workshop Participant | Google DeepMind & Mila | Mar 31 - Apr 11, 2025 | Muizenberg, South Africa

Comprehensive workshop on large language models, covering architecture design, training techniques, scaling laws, and deployment considerations from leading researchers at Google DeepMind and Mila.

Teaching Philosophy

My teaching approach emphasizes:

  • Practical Implementation: Balancing theoretical foundations with hands-on coding experience
  • Real-World Applications: Connecting ML/CV concepts to problems relevant to developing regions
  • Collaborative Learning: Fostering peer-to-peer knowledge sharing and group problem-solving
  • Research-Oriented Thinking: Encouraging students to think critically and explore open problems

Interested in collaborating on workshops or teaching opportunities? Feel free to reach out.
